Package objectorinetedprogramming.assignment1

Class Employee

java.lang.Object
objectorinetedprogramming.assignment1.Employee
public class Employee extends Object
Employee class represents the specification for the employee object. Employee has certain attributes such as name and position. Employee can help the customer with booking a ticket and he can also process payments from the customer.
Author:
Jozef Yika

  • Constructor Details

    • Employee

      public Employee()
      Default constructor sets the name and position to values shown below. This keyword points to the current Object.

    • Employee

      public Employee​(String name, String position)
      Custom constructor accepts two parameters and assigns their values to the fields/attributes. The values will be passed in the main method when the employee object is created or when the on of the setter methods are invoked.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the employee
      position - Position of the employee

  • Method Details

    • setName

      public void setName​(String name)
      Sets the name of the employee. Whatever string value we will be passing in the main method when the setName is invoked , this value will be assigned to the attribute 'name'.
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the employee

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the employee. Returns the value that is being stored in attribute name.
      Returns:
      the name of the employee.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition​(String position)
      Sets the position of he employee
      Parameters:
      position - is stored in the position variable

    • getPostion

      public String getPostion()
      Returns the position fo the customer as a string (i.e assistant etc. )
      Returns:
      the current value of the variable position

    • interactWithCustomer

      public void interactWithCustomer​(Customer customer, Movie movie, boolean pay, ChildCustomer child)
      Method 'interactWithCustomer' accepts 4 parameters as shown below. In the body of this method I am checking for the following: 1. Does the customer want to book a movie? 2. Does he/she have enough cash/money on the credit card to book a ticket? 3. Is the customer old enough to watch a movie? 4. What's the price of the ticket if the customer is a child?
      Parameters:
      customer - is a customer that is helping the customer
      movie - is a movie that the customer has chosen
      pay - checks whether the customer decided to book a ticket or not. This is set to either true or false in the main when this method is invoked.
      child - is a customer who is a child

    • processPayment

      public void processPayment​(Customer customer, Movie movie)
      Method 'processPayment' accepts two arguments as shown below. In the body of this method I print out messages that the customer has book a ticket for movie and the details of that movie. This method is invoked in the 'interactWithCustomer' method only when all of the criteria for the customer to watch a movie has been met.
      Parameters:
      customer - is a customer that the employee is helping
      movie - is a movie that customer has chosen

    • toString

      public String toString()
      This just returns the name. I didn't really have a need of overriding toString method in more details.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
